discoveries.name: Amazon BTS2
discoveries.description: Amazon BTS2 is the central fulfilment centre that processes all returns from Europe. This is the centralised location where all trackers meet. It was built in 2017 in the Slovakian city of Sereď and covers an area of around 60.000m².

discoveries.name: Amazon CGN1
discoveries.description: Amazon CGN1 is located in the A61 industrial park in Kobern-Gondorf.  It was put into operation in 2012 and Amazon employs around 1.800 people here in an area of around 110.000m².

discoveries.name: Amazon DTM8
discoveries.description: The Amazon DTM8 in Krefeld doesn’t store any goods. Instead, deliveries from other Amazon logistics centres arrive here for direct processing. The shipments are sorted by postcode and then sent on. Either directly to customers in Krefeld and the surrounding area, or to other Amazon logistics centres in Germany and Europe.

discoveries.name: Amazon KSF7
discoveries.description: Amazon KSF7 only opened in September 2020, making it one of the newest sorting centres in Germany. For this reason, the 5.500m² building is not yet visible on the satellite images.

discoveries.name: Amazon KTW1
discoveries.description: Amazon KTW1 opened in 2017 and is one of the centres marking Amazon's expansion into Eastern European countries.

discoveries.name: Amazon LYS8
discoveries.description: Amazon LYS8 is a warehouse of the French domain of Amazon. No further information can be found about this location.

discoveries.name: Amazon STR1
discoveries.description: Amazon STR1 was put into operation in autumn 2012. According to Amazon, around 1.500 people are employed here and the building spans an area of 110.000m².

discoveries.name: CEVA Logistics
discoveries.description: CEVA Logistics is a global logistics and supply chain company in both freight management and contract logistics. The site in Poland is passed by some trackers before they return to Germany.

discoveries.name: Relais Colis
discoveries.description: Relais Colis is a French shipping company whose location in Combs-la-Ville is passed by the tracker sent back from France before it enters the actual Amazon infrastructure.

discoveries.name: DHL Paketzentrum Neumark
discoveries.description: The DHL parcel centre in Neumark is one of the central sorting centres through which all trackers returned from Germany pass. It seems to be a necessary point of re-sorting for all returns that go on to Eastern Europe in the next step.
